metadata.dc:author: Gianinetti, Leonardo
Imhof, Hugo
Burlando, Eduardo
Pierini, Leandro
Pierini, Angel
metadata.dc:description: Acute necrotizing esophagitis, also known as black esophagus, represents an extremely rare clinical entity, defined by the black pigmentation of the esophagus, secondary to necrosis of the mucosa and detected at endoscopy. We present a clinical case of this rare disease, with its manifestation, diagnosis, treatment, and we perform a review of the literature.
metadata.dc:title: Esofagitis necrosante aguda. Reporte de un caso.
[Acute necrotizing esophagitis. Case report].
